content.text:
# Your Job

Open `config/CRONS.json` and modify the heartbeat cron job:
1. Change the schedule to `*/10 * * * *` (every 10 minutes)
2. Set `enabled: true` to activate it
3. Keep all other fields (name, description, etc.) unchanged

After making the changes, verify the JSON is valid and save the file.

content.thinking:
The user wants me to modify the `config/CRONS.json` file, specifically the heartbeat cron job. I need to:
1. Change the schedule to `*/10 * * * *` (every 10 minutes)
2. Set `enabled: true`
3. Keep all other fields unchanged

Let me first read the file to see its current structure.

content.text: I'll help you modify the heartbeat cron job in `config/CRONS.json`. Let me first read the file to see its current structure.

[
  {
    "name": "heartbeat",
    "schedule": "*/30 * * * *",
    "type": "agent",
    "job": "Read the file at config/HEARTBEAT.md and complete the tasks described there.",
    "enabled": false
  },
  {
    "name": "daily-check",
    "schedule": "0 9 * * *",
    "type": "agent",
    "job": "Check for dependency updates in package.json and report any outdated packages.",
    "enabled": false
  },
  {
    "name": "ping",
    "schedule": "*/1 * * * *",
    "type": "command",
    "command": "echo \"pong!\"",
    "enabled": true
  },
  {
    "name": "cleanup-logs",
    "schedule": "0 0 * * 0",
    "type": "command",
    "command": "ls -la logs/",
    "enabled": false
  },
  {
    "name": "ping-status",
    "schedule": "*/5 * * * *",
    "type": "webhook",
    "url": "https://example.com/status",
    "method": "POST",
    "vars": { "source": "heartbeat" },
    "enabled": false
  },
  {
    "name": "health-check",
    "schedule": "*/10 * * * *",
    "type": "webhook",
    "url": "https://example.com/health",
    "method": "GET",
    "enabled": false
  }
]

content.thinking:
Good! I can see the file structure. The heartbeat cron job is the first one in the array. Currently it has:
- name: "heartbeat"
- schedule: "*/30 * * * *" (every 30 minutes)
- type: "agent"
- job: "Read the file at config/HEARTBEAT.md and complete the tasks described there."
- enabled: false

I need to:
1. Change schedule from "*/30 * * * *" to "*/10 * * * *"
2. Change enabled from false to true
3. Keep everything else the same

I'll use the edit function to make this change.

content.text: Now I'll modify the heartbeat cron job to run every 10 minutes and enable it:

arguments.oldText:
{
    "name": "heartbeat",
    "schedule": "*/30 * * * *",
    "type": "agent",
    "job": "Read the file at config/HEARTBEAT.md and complete the tasks described there.",
    "enabled": false
  },
arguments.newText:
{
    "name": "heartbeat",
    "schedule": "*/10 * * * *",
    "type": "agent",
    "job": "Read the file at config/HEARTBEAT.md and complete the tasks described there.",
    "enabled": true
  },

details.diff:
1 [
  2   {
  3     "name": "heartbeat",
- 4     "schedule": "*/30 * * * *",
+ 4     "schedule": "*/10 * * * *",
  5     "type": "agent",
  6     "job": "Read the file at config/HEARTBEAT.md and complete the tasks described there.",
- 7     "enabled": false
+ 7     "enabled": true
  8   },
  9   {
 10     "name": "daily-check",
 11     "schedule": "0 9 * * *",
    ...

content.thinking: Great! The edit was successful. Now let me verify that the JSON is valid and the changes were applied correctly by reading the file again.

content.text: Perfect! Now let me verify the changes and validate the JSON:

[

    "name": "heartbeat",
    "schedule": "*/10 * * * *",
    "type": "agent",
    "job": "Read the file at config/HEARTBEAT.md and complete the tasks described there.",
    "enabled": true
  },
  {
    "name": "daily-check",
    "schedule": "0 9 * * *",
    "type": "agent",
    "job": "Check for dependency updates in package.json and report any outdated packages.",
    "enabled": false
  },
  {
    "name": "ping",
    "schedule": "*/1 * * * *",
    "type": "command",
    "command": "echo \"pong!\"",
    "enabled": true
  },
  {
    "name": "cleanup-logs",

    "type": "command",
    "command": "ls -la logs/",
    "enabled": false

  {
    "name": "ping-status",
    "schedule": "*/5 * * * *",
    "type": "webhook",
    "url": "https://example.com/status",
    "method": "POST",

content.thinking: Excellent! Let me verify the JSON syntax by using a command to check if it's valid JSON.
Perfect! The JSON is valid and the changes have been successfully applied. Let me summarize what was done.

content.text:
✅ **Job completed successfully!**

I've modified the heartbeat cron job in `config/CRONS.json`:

**Changes made:**
- ✓ Schedule changed from `*/30 * * * *` to `*/10 * * * *` (now runs every 10 minutes instead of every 30 minutes)
- ✓ Enabled status changed from `false` to `true` (the cron job is now active)
- ✓ All other fields (name, type, job description) remain unchanged

**Verification:**
- JSON syntax is valid ✓
- The heartbeat cron job will now execute every 10 minutes and run the agent task described in `config/HEARTBEAT.md`

The changes have been saved to the file.
